intro: Lasianthaea fruticosa var. fruticosa, commonly known as the shrub lasianthaea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woody growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. The plant has small, simple leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it a notable species in its native ecosystems.
